case.name: Julien v Secretary, Department of Employment and Workplace Relations (No 2) [2009] FCA 1259 (6 November 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: proceedings commenced in local court for $11,923.17 for services rendered
unsuccessful application for transfer of those proceedings to federal court
adverse order for costs following that event made on indemnity basis
unsuccessful party gave notice of intention to have successful party's bill of costs 'dismissed' but did not appear on any such application
order made by federal court in favour of successful party for fixed sum for costs in lieu of need for taxation of those costs federal court rules
whether lump sum costs orders should be made
where indemnity costs awarded. exclusion of gst.

citances.sentence: 22 The Courts have considered a number of factors in deciding whether to make a gross sum costs order. They include the conduct of the Defendant in connection with the proceedings ( Sony Entertainment v Smith [2005] FCA 228 ; (2005) 215 ALR 788) ; whether the party obliged to pay the costs order is able to meet a liability which is likely to result from assessment ( Beach Petroleum NL v Johnson (No. 2) (1995) 57 FCR 119 ; Hadid v Lenfest Communications Inc Julien v Secretary of Department of Employment and Workplace Relations (No. 2) [2009] FCA 1259 at [12] per Spender J) and the related question of whether the costs of the proceedings are disproportionate to the amount claimed ( Kiwi Munchies Pty Limited v Stern [2006] NSWSC 433 at [17] per McClellan CJ at [6]).

legistitles.title: FEDERAL COURT OF AUSTRALIA ACT 1976
FEDERAL COURT OF AUSTRALIA ACT 1976 - SECT 43 Costs
